ATTENDANT
Pinnace, purchased 1614
1 1614/5 East Indies
Master Thomas Hounsell/John Alexander
Left England Dec 1614 - Cape 18 May 1615 - 24 Jul Bantam - sent for Jambi Sep-Oct 1615 - made voyages to Jambi, the Bandas and Macassar 1616-1618 - captured by the Dutch 25 Mar 1618 and taken to Japan - eventually handed back, but abandoned in 1622

L/MAR/A/LXm Journal 6 Apr 1637-4 Feb 1638, anon 
Captain John Weddell
Downs 14 Apr 1636 -30 Apr Catherine and Planter lost company - Planter rejoined - 4 Jun Discovery sent back to England, Anne sent for India alone - 27 Aug Johanna - Goa, joined there by Catherine and Anne, left 17 Jan 1637 - 6 Apr Planter sent back to England - 21 Apr Acheh - 27 Jun Macao - 8 Aug Anunghol - captured Chinese fort - 30 Aug Tiger Island 26 Sep -19 Sep fought Chinese junks - 27 Sep Macao, Anne sold there, Catherine left 20 Dec, Dragon and Sun 29 Dec - 16 Jan 1638 Malacca - 3 Feb Acheh - Sep Cape - St Helena - Dec Downs

1 1822/3 Bengal and Madras
L/MAR/B/124H Deck Log 10 May 1823-7 Jul 1824
Capt Charles Beach
Downs 17 Jun 1823 - 27 Oct Calcutta - 4 Jan 1824 Diamond Harbour -13 Jan Vizagapatam - 22 Jan Madras -11 Feb Point de Galle - 8 Apr Cape - 14 May St Helena - 4 Jul Downs Sank at her anchors at Garden Island, Western Australia, Apr 1831. TIGER
Interloper, 200 tons
1 1604/5 Bantam
Expedition commanded by Sir Edward Michclbornc
Received Royal licence 25 Jun 1604 - left Cowes with Tiger's Whelp pinnace 5 Dec 1604 - 8 Apr 1605 Cape - 25 Jul Coast of Sumatra - 13 Aug Priaman - 28 Oct Bantam - left for Pattani 2 Nov, attacked by Japanese pirates, pilot John Davis killed, voyage abandoned - 9 Jul 1606 Portsmouth See Purchas vol. 1 bk.3 chap. 1 s.6 for a summary journal, and The voyages and works of John Davis the Navigator, ed Albert Hastings Markham, Hakluyt Soc 1st ser no.59 (London, 1880)
